abstracts.cdata!:
The revised target of the Education
            Sector Reform Project of Chad is to improve access and
            equity of the education system and to develop institutional
            capacity. This goal is in line with the state policy
            contained in the National Strategy for Growth and Reduction
            of Poverty which states that all children should be ensured
            a primary education of universal quality, eliminating
            disparities in access to education, health, nutrition and
            non-farm employment and establishing social safety nets
            needed to improve living conditions of street children, the
            disabled, women, old persons and other outcasts of society.
            The negative environmental impacts of the project result
            from construction of latrines and water points in terms of
            disruption of living conditions, and production of solid and
            liquid waste. The exploitation of quarries for extraction of
            construction materials could also be sources of negative
            impacts to the environment, which will require restorative
            actions after use. Environmental impacts such as soil
            erosion, pollution of soil and water, loss of vegetation,
            and impacts due to increased waste solids and liquids may
            come from the activities of construction of latrines and
            wells and the opening and operation of quarries for building
            materials. In the preparation phase of construction, the
            impacts are related to cutting trees to clear the targeted
            sites and extraction of construction materials and building
            waste. In short, direct and indirect effects are expected
            from: the pollution caused by uncontrolled discharge of
            solid and liquid waste, noise, dust, risk of accidents, soil
            erosion, and the likely reduction of vegetation cover in the
            area allowed for construction or operation of quarries.
